attributes.comment:
I am strongly opposed to the level of increase proposed for the application for
citizenship. I teach Adult Ed and we have many students who are studying for
citizenship. Additionally, dozens of previous students successfully passed their
INS interview and are now citizens.

I believe the fees as they are today are already a hardship. Many of our students
are working two jobs and can barely support their families, let alone afford the
$400 application fee. Rasing the application fee to $595 will be a burden that
many hardworking immigrants will not be able to afford.

Surely we're not saying as a country that we only want rich immigrants! But this is
the message that is being heard.

Please, if you must raise the fees, raise them only a little. There are many other
wasteful government programs where monies to improve immigration offices could
be found. Don't take it out of poor immigrants who can little afford the fees as they
are today!

Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Katherine P. Bennett
